title: What is fractional QA?
description: Quality assurance (QA) is essential for any SaaS startup or software company aiming to deliver reliable, bug-free products. The challenge many founders and managers run into is many services are designed for enterprise clients only, while having a limited offering for startups. What's worse, is you may not be able to find a cost-effective option that you can scale up and down as needed. Enter fractional QA, a new way to QA your startup's products without hiring a full-time team. Let's look deeper into how fractional QA can benefit your SaaS startup.
subtitle: Your startup has a new secret weapon, see how it works.
shortDescription: Curious about what a fractional QA actually is? Not sure how fractional QA can help your startup thrive? Learn more by reading this article!

What is a fractional QA?
A fractional QA specialist, such as
QAComet

, manages your products' quality. You would hire a fractional QA based on a monthly retainer so you can spend less time worrying about problems with your products and instead focus on building and launching new features. With this setup, you can subscribe for a short period of time while your startup needs to improve your products. This could mean hiring a fractional QA before a round of funding or getting outside expertise on integrating QA as a culture within your company.

Some common QA anti-patterns found in SaaS startups

It is a common mistake to assume quality can be everyone's responsibility, but when this management anti-pattern is applied everyone loses. If you use this anti-pattern while building a startup, you're expecting engineers to release features quicker while also asking them to slow down and ensure the product works well. These conflicting constraints are difficult to maintain and often quality suffers as more features are released.

Why fractional QA is perfect for startups

Building a startup is hard, but managing a QA team shouldn't be. We've created an easy monthly package that lets founders stay focused on building their company instead of worrying about yet another fire they have to put out. Having QA as part of your product development pipeline will accelerate robust feature releases that your customers love. Instead of having to continuously go back and adjust features after releases, we make it possible to find the best possible UX workflows and aid your developers in releasing software that isn't riddled with bugs.
